alert.note: Alert for Pend Oreille (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 21 at 4:14PM PDT until May 21 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Bonner County in the Panhandle of Idaho... Central Pend Oreille County in northeastern Washington... * Until 500 PM PDT. * At 414 PM PDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 19 miles southwest of Nordman, or 29 miles northwest of Priest River, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Nordman, Cusick, Lost Creek, Browns Lake Campground, Noisy Creek Campground, Ruby, and Tiger. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
